body.p: In contrast, IFRS 17 requires entities to present revenue for insurance contracts determined in a way that is broadly consistent with the general principles in IFRS 15. Consistent with that Standard, an entity depicts revenue for the transfer of promised coverage and other services at an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for the services. This means that the entity:

li.p: excludes from insurance revenue any investment components; and
recognises insurance revenue in each period as it satisfies the performance obligations in the insurance contracts.
